title: 110_hr2699
content: Section 1 amends Section 2012(a)(2) of title 38, United States Code by removing certain subparagraphs and adjusting the rate of per diem payments to homeless veterans service centers. Section 2 establishes a demonstration program to prevent veterans at risk of homelessness from becoming homeless. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will conduct a demonstration program in at least three locations to identify active duty members at risk of homelessness upon discharge and provide them with supportive services to prevent homelessness. The criteria for identifying at-risk members will be developed in consultation with the Secretary of Defense. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may enter into contracts for referral, counseling, and supportive services under a demonstration program. The authority expires on September 30, 2011, with an authorization of $2,000,000 for implementation. The authority for a program of referral and counseling services for at-risk veterans transitioning from certain institutions is expanded and extended. The program authority for referral and counseling services for at-risk veterans is amended to expand the scope and extend the authority until September 30, 2011. The heading of section 2023 is amended to focus on veterans at risk of homelessness transitioning from certain institutions. Section 2022(f)(2)(C) is amended by removing "demonstration." A clerical amendment updates the table of sections in chapter 20 of the title. The availability of grant funds for service centers for personnel under Section 2011 of title 38, United States Code, allows for funding staff to meet service availability requirements. Additionally, there is a permanent authority for domiciliary services for homeless veterans and an enhancement of capacity for domiciliary care programs for female veterans. Subsection (b) of section 2043 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to enhance the capacity of domiciliary care programs for female veterans to meet their needs.
